basics.name: Jimmy Lo
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: As early as I can remember, I've been a tinkerer, builder, and techie. At Georgia Tech, I studied computer science and went on to work for several design and web development firms. Most recently, I worked at the DeKalb Library as their in-house programmer, responsible for all facets of their online presence and internal operations. Currently, I'm looking for new technical challenges and a work environment where I can grow. I value good design, elegant code, and learning new things.

highlights: Redesigned and built out a new version of the DeKalb County Public Library site
Developed a responsive HTML5 site for Encyclomedia (in progress)
Shot and edited videos for Wages Films

work.summary: Moved the library from a 90's style static page to a fully interactive online presence.
highlights: Redesigned and built the library's website, making information responsive, accessible, and editable
Created an app for librarians to enter programs for publication on the website's events calendar
Created an app that fed library information to TV screens that greet patrons when they enter the library
Built a complete intranet solution to facilitate communication within the organization
Started and created content for DCPLive (blog) and DCPLink (newsletter)
Created the library's online presence to facilitate patron interactions on Twitter, Facebook, Flickr, Pinterest, and YouTube
Grew online following on social media services, including 1400 followers on Twitter and 3700 Likes on Facebook
Created and maintained three podcasts delivering original audio content to patrons

work.summary: Key member of a web development team making sites for local small businesses in Tucson, Arizona.
highlights: Created PHP and MySQL driven e-commerce sites under strict deadlines
Helped develop and conceive a PHP-based content management system for use across client sites

work.summary: Worked closely with a team of graphic designers to deliver beautiful, effective websites for clients.
highlights: Implemented large-scale, interactive, and dynamic websites using HTML, Flash, Actionscript, and ASP
Created smooth user experiences from visual designs

work.summary: Assisted in the development of Word Pro, a word processing application for the desktop.

volunteer.summary: Created data visualization dashboard for Atlanta Regional Commission
Ongoing efforts to revitalize South Downtown Atlanta through tech
highlights: Converted data for use in asset map of area
Helped build interactive asset map of South Downtown
Conceived and organized over 60 Free Poems on Demand performances
Worked in close collaboration with organizers of events, such as the Decatur Book Festival, Chomp and Stomp, and Atlanta Streets Alive
Recruited over 20 members to write free poems
Created and managed the Free Poems on Demand website and online presence
Increased awareness of poetry in Atlanta

volunteer.summary: Helped local organic farmers weed, plant, harvest, and do other tasks
Helped pick over a thousand pounds of wild fruit per year for local food banks

publications.name: A Reduction
publications.summary: Prose poem on the seduction of the miniscule

publications.name: An Attempt at Re-exhausting a Place in Paris
publications.summary: Following Oulipian writer Georges Perec through time and space using Google Maps
